name: Duopa

indications.text: duopa® indicated treatment motor fluctuations patients advanced parkinson ’ disease .

contraindications.text: maximum recommended daily dose duopa 2000 mg levodopa ( i.e . , one cassette per day ) administered 16 hours ( 2.1 ) prior initiating duopa , convert patients forms levodopa oral immediate-release carbidopa-levodopa tablets ( 1:4 ratio ) ( 2.2 ) titrate total daily dose based response patient ( 2.2 ) administer duopa jejunum percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy jejunal tube ( peg-j ) cadd®-legacy 1400 portable infusion pump ( 2.3 )

warningsAndPrecautions: single-use cassettes containing 4.63 mg carbidopa ( 5 mg monohydrate ) 20 mg levodopa per ml enteral suspension . cassette contains approximately 100 ml suspension . carton 7 duopa cassettes : ndc 0074-3012-07
adverseReactions: duopa contraindicated patients currently taking nonselective monoamine oxidase ( mao ) inhibitor ( e.g . , phenelzine tranylcypromine ) recently ( within 2 weeks ) taken nonselective mao inhibitor . hypertension occur drugs used concurrently [ ( 7.1 7.2 ) ] .
indications_original: DUOPA® is indicated for the treatment of motor fluctuations in patients with advanced Parkinson’s disease.
contraindications_original: The maximum recommended daily dose of DUOPA is 2000 mg of levodopa (i.e., one cassette per day) administered over 16 hours ( 2.1 ) Prior to initiating DUOPA, convert patients from all forms of levodopa to oral immediate-release carbidopa-levodopa tablets (1:4 ratio) ( 2.2 ) Titrate total daily dose based on clinical response for the patient ( 2.2 ) Administer DUOPA into the jejunum through a percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy with jejunal tube (PEG-J) with the CADD®-Legacy 1400 portable infusion pump ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Single-use cassettes containing 4.63 mg carbidopa (as 5 mg of the monohydrate) and 20 mg levodopa per mL of enteral suspension. Each cassette contains approximately 100 mL of suspension. 
                        Carton of 7 DUOPA cassettes: NDC 0074-3012-07
adverseReactions_original:
DUOPA is contraindicated in patients who are currently taking a nonselective monoamine oxidase (MAO) inhibitor (e.g., phenelzine and tranylcypromine) or have recently (within 2 weeks) taken a nonselective MAO inhibitor. Hypertension can occur if these drugs are used concurrently [see Drug Interactions (
                     
                        7.1
                     
                      and 
                     
                        7.2
                     
                     )].
